doc.after: On 1 October 1956 the Ministry of Supply asked Morgan to form a new study group, the Supersonic Transport Advisory Committee or STAC,[12] with the explicit goal of developing a practical SST design and finding industry partners to build it. At the very first meeting, on 5 November 1956, the decision was made to fund the development of a testbed aircraft to examine the low speed performance of the slender delta, a contract that eventually produced the Handley Page HP.115.[11] This aircraft would ultimately demonstrate safe control at speeds as low as 69Â mph, about ârd that of the Starfighter.[13]
